page.title: 01SKIPTON
page.content: Skipton is situated about 15 km North West of Keighley in the Aire Valley. Its site marks the North-Western boundary of Industrial West Yorkshire & the Southern boundary of the Yorkshire Dales, characterised by up-faulted carboniferous limestone. Peat & grit stone moors overlooking old industrial valleys, being more typical downstream.The canal & railway stimulated growth in limestone quarrying & textiles.Some new light industries along main roads.New by-pass helped relieve traffic congestion since 1983. The town probably best known as a tourist town acting as the gateway to the Dales. Employment is generally better than average but tending towards market or seasonal occupations. All the textile Mills are now closed.
